bill.title: Money Transmitters; Change in Control; Division of Financial Institutions; Criminal History Record Check
bill.description: Amends requirements under the money transmitters law for money transmitter licensee change in control applications, including requiring a criminal history record check on persons who will assume control of the licensee. Updates a reference to federal Regulation E. (SD1)

history.action: Pending introduction.
Introduced and Pass First Reading.
Referred to CPC, FIN, referral sheet 4
Bill scheduled to be heard by CPC on Monday, 02-08-16 2:05PM in House conference room 325.
The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until 02-10-16 at 2:00 pm.
Bill scheduled for decision making on Wednesday, 02-10-16 2:00PM in conference room 325.

The committees on CPC recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 13 Ayes: Representative(s) McKelvey, Woodson, Brower, Har, Hashem, Kawakami, Nakashima, Oshiro, San Buenaventura, Takayama, Yamane, Fukumoto Chang, McDermott; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 3 Excused: Representative(s) Belatti, Creagan, C. Lee.
Reported from CPC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 635-16), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to FIN.
Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Nakashima, Thielen, Tokioka excused (3).
Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Wednesday, 02-24-16 2:00PM in House conference room 308.

The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 15 Ayes: Representative(s) Luke, Nishimoto, Cachola, Cullen, DeCoite, Johanson, Jordan, Keohokalole, Kobayashi, LoPresti, Lowen, Onishi, Tokioka, Yamashita, Pouha; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Ward.
Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 900-16) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Third Reading.
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 03-08-16.
Passed Third Reading as amended in HD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 289).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to CPH, JDL.
The committee(s) on CPH has scheduled a public hearing on 03-16-16 9:00AM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on CPH recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in CPH were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Baker, Kidani, Espero, Nishihara, Ruderman; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Ihara, Slom.
Reported from CPH (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2902) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to JDL.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDL.
The committee(s) on JDL will hold a public decision making on 03-31-16 9:30AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in JDL were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Keith-Agaran, Gabbard, Kim, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) Shimabukuro, K.Kahele, L. Thielen.
Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3464) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading.
One Day Notice 04-12-16.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading. Ayes, 24; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 1 (Senator(s) Slom). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 598) in amended form (SD 1).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 609).
House Conferees Appointed: McKelvey, Cachola Co-Chairs; Oshiro, Fukumoto Chang.
Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 611).
Senate Conferees Appointed: Baker Chair; Keith-Agaran Co-Chair; Kidani.
Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 669).
Bill scheduled for Conference Committee Meeting on Monday, 04-25-16 2:50PM in conference room 016.
Conference committee meeting to reconvene on 04-27-16 2:30PM in conference room 016.
Conference committee meeting to reconvene on 04-29-16 10:30AM in conference room 016.

The House Conference Managers recommend to agree to the Senate Amendments. The votes were as follows: 3 Ayes: Representative(s) McKelvey, Cachola, Fukumoto Chang; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Oshiro.
Reconsideration of action taken on 04-14-16.
Received notice of House reconsideration of action in disagreeing to the amendments proposed by the Senate (Hse. Com. No. 676).
House agrees to Senate amendment(s).
Passed Final Reading as amended in SD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Souki excused (1).
Received notice of House agreement and passage on Final Reading (Hse. Com. No. 684).
Transmitted to Governor.
